title: Verify that the already set source and target hold codes at event admin is retained even if the hold code status is changed to Inactive

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Login to PV
2. Navigate to Event Administration
3.Click on New
4.Click on Source hold code search icon in 
the Table Seating pane
5.Select one hold code (Example OPEN)
6.Click on Target hold code search icon in the 
Table Seating pane
7.Select one hold code (Example GRP)
8.Create the event
2. Launch PV Application using the link provided
3. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
4. 1.Navigate to Supplier Admin
2.Select the supplier
3.Navigate to Configuration tab
4.Select Hold Codes from the drop down
5.Select the Source hold code set for the 
event (here it is OPEN)
6.Change the status to inactive
7.Select the target hold code set for the event 
(here it is GRP)
5. .Verify that the source and target hold codes 
are not removed even though its status is 
changed to inactive
6. 1.Navigate to Event Administration
2.Click on New
3.Verify that the inactive hold code is not 
listed in Target Hold code search list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requsite should be ready
2. PV Application should be launched 
successfully
3. Login should be successfull
4. Hold code status should be changed
5. The source and target hold codes should not 
be removed even though its status is 
changed to inactive
6. User should benavigated to Event 
Administration page

title: Verify that the seats are locked properly from the defined extended seat configuration if it is set in Venue

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Login to PV
2.Navigate to Venue Admin
3.Select the supplier and venue 
4.Select some seats and set an Extended 
Seat Definition
5.Navigate to Event Administration
6.Click on New
7.Set a source hold code
8.Set a target hold code
9.Set Extended Seat Configuration defined in 
Venue
10.Click on Apply changes
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Ticket Sales
2.Select the event and lock seats from the 
source hold code and ESD
3.Complete the sale
4.Navigate to Ticket Services->Order details page
4. Verify that the seats are locked correctly from 
the ESD
5. Launch PV Application using the link provided
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requsite should be ready
2. Login should be successfull
3. User should be navigated to ticket service page 
and select the order
4. Seats should be locked properly from the 
defined extended seat configuration if it is set 
in Venue

If an extended seat configuration is defined 
then this feature shall apply when at least 
one locked seat on the source hold code also 
is covered by the defined extended seat 
configuration
5. PV Application should be launched 
successfully

title: Verify that the linked seats from the source hold code which have ESD defined are moved to Target hold code automatically

custom_steps_separated.content:

2.Navigate to Venue Admin
3.Select the supplier and select table seating 
venue 
4.Select some seats and set an Extended 
Seat Definition
5.Navigate to Event Administration
6.Click on New
7.Set a source hold code
8.Set a target hold code
9.Set Extended Seat Configuration defined in 
Venue
10.Click on Apply changes
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Navigate to Ticket Sales
2.Select the event and lock 2 SEATS from a 
table of 4 seats from the sorce hold code and 
ESD
3.Complete the sale
4. Verify the hold code of the remaining 2 seats 
which were not sold (Linked seats)
5. Launch PV Application using the link provided
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requsite should be ready
2. Login should be successfull
3. User should be able to do transaction
4. The linked seats from the defined ESD should 
moved to Target hold code

If an extended seat configuration is defined then 
this feature shall apply when at least one locked 
seat on the source hold code also is covered by 
the defined extended seat configuration, and the 
application of the target linked hold code would 
only be applied to linked/contiguous seats also 
covered by the extended seat configuration
5. PV Application should be launched 
successfully

title: Verify that the Contiguous seats of the locked seats are also locked from the source hold code for a table seating configured event for a single sale transaction

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Login to PV
2. Navigate to Event Administration
3.Click on New
4. Set Extended Seat Configuration
5. Set a source hold code
6.Set a target hold code
7.Click on Apply changes
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 2.Navigate to Ticket Sales
3.Load the above created event
4.Lock 2 seats from the source hold code 
defined at event admin from a table of 4 seats
4. Verify that the left/right contiguous seats of the 
above locked seats are also locked in the cart
5. Launch PV Application using the link provided
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requsite should be ready
2. Login should be successfull
3. User should be able to lock 2 seats
4. Locked 2 seats and remaining 2 contiguous 
seats of the table should be locked to the cart

The  left/right contiguous seats of the above 
locked seats belogs to the source hold code 
should also be locked in the cart

When configured for an event, if seats are 
locked via the source hold code in a shopping 
cart for sales or reservations, then ProVenue 
shall also lock all left and right contiguous, 
available seats. This shall include any seats 
to the left and right with contiguous proximity 
(to the sales/locked seats) which are also on 
the source hold code and will continue until 
either no further contiguous seats are found 
or a seat not available via the source hold 
code is found
5. PV Application should be launched 
successfully
